content.label:
You see a lot of similar puzzle games on the App Store. This one is different enough to feel fresh and new. Fairly simple mechanics, but some of the puzzles can be quite tricky. 

Kenny Sun and the Sun family in general are amazingly creative. I highly recommend giving all his apps a go. üëçüèª
For $3.99 there should be a tutorial included with the app
A well thought out and well executed puzzle game, offering many challenging levels, a satisfying ending, and a bit of humor and personality mixed in.  I enjoyed every moment!
I really love the creator‚Äôs other game Triangles, and this one is also great.  Simple but challenging mechanics, great atmosphere, makes you think without being impossible to figure out.

title.label: The most honest five stars I have ever given.

content.label: This game is so long for what it costs! Not only that, the graphics are amazing and there is even a ‚Äúlevel skip‚Äù system that is so good for players like me, who can grasp the basic concepts, but not all of the more complex and nuanced actions, who can just skip the levels with complex solutions that we don‚Äôt entirely grasp. The App Store needs more games like this. Great work to the developers who were able to package this amazing piece of eye candy and a weeks worth of brain teasers in such a small package (that is, my overcrowded and old phone) üëçüëçüëç
I love puzzle games. This is the best I've seen in awhile. And the design is fresh and awesome, with lots of great levels. I can only hope there's a sequel!

A real challenge, but once you get the hang of it, it is immense fun.  I have beaten the game (it took a while, as it has many very different levels) and I continue to replay because it's so enjoyable. It racks your brain in a good way.  Very unique--unlike any other iPhone game I've played.  I super recommend.
Some levels are frustratingly hard - and this is a good thing üòÅ
One word says it all
Challenging yet not impossible puzzles with beautiful colors yet simple geometric shapes keeps you focused. Very hard to beat.

I have been an avid iOS gamer for several years. This is by far my favorite puzzle game that I have encountered on the platform. There is something incredibly satisfying about mastering its various mechanics (which are rolled out brilliantly) and putting them to use. Please support Kenny and family.
Some levels come together very nicely, and other require quite a bit of thought. I'm through part one and absolutely love this game.
Somehow manages to create an experience that is both challenging and zen-like.
This is a really fun puzzler. Only takes a second to learn. At first glance, each level looks like it should be so easy to complete, but some are very challenging. Beautiful minimalist graphics.

title.label: Bugs have been fixed, interesting and thought provoking game!

content.label: The developer has been great about fixing bugs for this game. It's a cool concept and now very playable!

If you are looking for a challenging and fun game, then you've found it. Cool graphics an sound, great challenging levels but you don't have to a member of MENSA figure them out. Exercising you brain is just as important as exercising your body. This is just the way to do it. Have fun!!
It looks like a great game but without direction I can't play which makes it no much fun.
this game is really well done. It makes you think but isn't impossible and makes you get creative with solutions. :) very worth it.
Great game, similar to Triangles. One big negative: the sound settings are broken--you cannot change the sound levels.
It's just the right level of complexity mixed with beautiful art and a heap of Kenny Sun style. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

I was working on one puzzle and the blue prism started glitching and was randomly appearing on different parts of the screen (not on the puzzle board). I wish there were some more practice/tutorial levels also to help players get a handle on the controls and how to move the other colored prisms before tossing you into the actual game mode. Some of these puzzles are incredibly difficult to move the other colored prisms without pushing them right off the board. 

Overall it's fun enough, but you may get too annoyed with the functionality. Additionally, there aren't any hint options, so if you get stuck, you're just stuck.
Tentatively pleased with the update. Level 5 no longer presents as a graphics processor overload crash. Once you get past the actual opening credits that follow the gameplay looks interesting.

This is a really excellent variant of the sliding block puzzle with pretty unique movement.  Simple controls, great implementation, just wonderful!  This guy makes some great and uniquely interesting games and this is my favorite of his so far.

I am not far enough through this yet to give it a thorough review, but did want to get at least one review out there to say that the developer jumped on the initial reported bugs quickly and it sure seems to be fine now. Quick work!

The programmer unfortunately designed level 5 in a way that totally appears like it crashes. The response to your actions slows to a crawl and the screen goes blank. But...if you wait about 5 seconds, you'll see that this is all a prelude to title screens and some welcome animations. After this, everything plays fine. The game is actually quite good!
As noted, even on an iPad Air Pro, the game becomes insanely sluggish on level 5, then crashes altogether. Major disappointment for an Apple featured game.

I purchased this and was so excited to play because I love yankai but it won't even go to the loading screen without crashing on my iPad mini. I'll keep it for a couple weeks to see if you guys can fix it, otherwise I'll delete it... As reluctant as I may be to do so.
Needs better thought out level 3.
